questions.question: Q1. The number of steps in which designing of forming process can be divided are:

explanations.a: Correct. Forming process design is typically divided into 5 major steps.
explanations.b: Incorrect. The process involves more than 3 steps.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Only 2 steps is too few for forming design.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Industrial practice generally uses 5 steps, not 8.

questions.question: Q2. Which of the following product is not manufactured by forming operation:

explanations.a: Incorrect. Fasteners can be made by cold heading (a forming process).
explanations.b: Incorrect. Many hand tools are drop forged.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Crankshafts are commonly manufactured by forging.
explanations.d: Correct. Lathe beds are typically made by casting, not forming.

questions.question: Q3. Which of the following is an advantage of forging:

explanations.a: Incorrect. Surface finish is generally not the best in forging.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Forging usually has high tooling cost.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Forging provides moderate tolerance, not the best.
explanations.d: Correct. Forging improves mechanical strength due to grain flow.

questions.question: Q4. Which one of the following may not be the variable that affect the metal forming process:

explanations.a: Incorrect. Material properties strongly affect forming.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Ram speed is a major forming variable.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Lubrication is a key process variable.
explanations.d: Correct. Surface lustre does not affect forming mechanics.

questions.question: Q5. In forging operation fullering is done to:

explanations.a: Correct. Fullering spreads material outward to draw it out.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Bending is a separate forming operation.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Upsetting increases cross-section, opposite of fullering.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Extrusion is not related to fullering.
